notesStmt.note: From the collection of Adam Clarke (b. 1762, d. 1832), Wesleyan Methodist minister and scholar: inscribed, folio 1v. Folio 1v (paper flyleaf at the beginning of the manuscript): a note of ownership of J. Noble Coleman: his bookplate with Latin inscription: recte sed suaviter (inner upper cover). The manuscript was given to him by George Pope, having been bought from a bookseller in Bristol.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Previously in the form of scroll, now in book-form.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi aquare script of the 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather. Gold tooled. Spine title: 'Esther. Hebrew. Oriental 1087.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Rev. John Noble Coleman (b. 1793, d.1872), Methodist missionary and scholar: bequeathed by him to the British Museum on 25 May 1872.
